column5: we have a dedicated STEM coordinator who supports\rteachers in designing and delivering active
column6: hands-on experiences across these four content areas. Teachers integrate technology into\rcurriculum
column12: and\riPads. We use Cognitively Guided Instruction (CGI) in mathematics. CGI is built on the belief children’s mathematical understanding that\rbest occurs when they participate in activities that link new knowledge to existing knowledge. The greatest value in our STEM work comes\rthrough the exposure to real-world applications in STEM. More specifically
column13: our engineering projects bridge content across the disciplines\rextending to writing and art as well. As students work as engineers
column14: they learn about the design cycle of define; develop; and optimize
column15: a\rprocess to make something functional. The engineering cycle is based on the belief that we learn through failures and partial successes.\rThese learning opportunities are designed to help students develop the problem-solving skills
column17: and resilience that will\rprepare them for successful lives the future.\r\rIn addition to our STEM focus
column18: we incorporate literacy across the curriculum. Teachers use research-based strategies to teach reading
column20: and vocabulary. Students read a variety of genres and express themselves in writing in every subject area. Teachers regularly\rexamine student work to analyze and support learning. Our literacy coach meets with the staff to provide high-level professional\rdevelopment
column22: and work directly with students. As students read and write across disciplines
column25: and written and verbal expression. Teachers assess students’ progress in reading regularly and adjust\rinstruction to meet student needs.\r\rOur staff members focus their work on our TK/K-5 students’ learning
column34: and an occupational therapist. These educators collaborate to provide a rich
column35: quality education to\rchildren and within a warm
column36: supportive environment. Our talented classified staff supports students and parents in in a number of settings\rand through systems that help them navigate the school environment. School visitors witness students who are actively engaged in their\rlearning and are accountable for their work. We have high expectations for every child at WRLC
column38: but they\ralso have fun.\r\rWe are a Title I school and receive additional funding that enables us to provide additional support services for children who need\rassistance in reaching grade-level standards. We have instructional assistants who support all grade levels in providing individualized and\rsmall group instruction in reading. Our teachers are highly qualified and committed to the collaboration they do with their colleagues at\rgrade level and other schoolwide meetings. They participate in ongoing professional development tied to research-based instructional\rpractices. During our professional-development meetings
column39: teachers have a unique opportunity to collaborate and engage in learning\ractivities that increase their understanding and ability to teach at the highest levels.\r\rWill Rogers is highly committed to a balanced visual and performing arts program for all students. All TK/ K-5 students participate in both\rmusic and visual arts programs throughout the year. Our third- through fifth-grade students also participate in poetry
column41: and dance.\rCome partner with our school
column43: and watch children learn and grow. This is a caring and special school. Will\rRogers is a learning community proud of its children
